result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain full time employment.
Obtain GED or HSED.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Jeff Larson.
No use of medications without a valid prescription.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of Extended Supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to MICHELLE HOFFMAN ROBERT E ELLSWORTH CORRECTIONAL CENTER UNION GROVE WI 53182
Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (262) 878-6016

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by DOC records office staff  and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 19 Judge Cimpl. os

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, with credit for 6 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment  
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with Jeff Larson
-No use of medications without a valid prescription
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Credit Sheet

Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing hearing. Court withdraws the previously issued bench warrant and reinstates bail. Defense counsel requests more time. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 19.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($1000.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Danielle Louise Shelton in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his  civil rights have been restored.  Defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Payment of these surcharges will be addressed on the day of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Attorney Shelton ill and requests another plea date.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter adjourned for a "soft" plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney just appointed to matter.  Case adjourned for plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court held sidebar.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, defendant failing to appear. Court authorized a bench warrant but stayed the warrant until the next court date. Defense requested a projected guilty plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 22.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Nicholas Cerwin for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Bobbi J Hochstetler

Prior: 1319 1/2 North 2nd Street, Wausau, WI 54403

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bobbi J Hochstetler in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
